revised_title: Anatomy of Liver Nerves, Biliary Ducts, and Gallbladder
tldr: The author, Robert Lee, investigates the distribution and arrangement of nerves in the liver, biliary ducts, and gallbladder. He discovers that nerves accompany the hepatic artery and form ganglia, which are connected to the semilunar ganglion and solar plexus. These nerves also surround the hepatic and cystic ducts and the walls of the vena portee.
